result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica R. Kuruc was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture or Deliver Prescription Drug [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).
  • Violate State/County Institution Laws [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
 May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monica R. Kuruc

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michel.  Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion count 4 is dismissed and read in. DE pleads guilty to count 1, 2 and 3. On count 1 court withholds sentence and places DE on 2 years probation with conditions. On count 2 court withholds sentence and places DE on 1 year probation with conditions concurrent to count 1. On count 3 court withholds sentence and places DE on 1 year probation concurrent with count 1 and 2.
Rotation letter for Adonis Julius Patrick returned.   Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
The date of 07/20/22 at 8:30 has been reset to 07/21/22 at 1:45 to be heard with the DE's other case.

Defendant Monica R. Kuruc appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:28 PM  Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Atty. William Michel appeared.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  No appearance by Deft.  Deft is in custody in Calumet County - writ to be done.  Preliminary Hearing set on May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  kmk
The PTC of 4/4/22 at 2pm was inadvertently scheduled as the case has not been to prelim yet; therefore the PTC of 4/4/22 at 2pm is removed from the calendar.

Defendant Monica R. Kuruc in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond modified to $500 signature bond with same conditions ( see bond event).  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Joanna M.
